Detailed Description

Interface to the CN78XX Free Pool Allocator, a.k.a.

FPA3

Revision
122227

static void cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura 
) [inline, static]

Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA.

The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().

Parameters:
scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in. This is a byte address but must be 8 byte aligned.
aura Global aura to get the block from
static void* cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc_finish ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura 
) [inline, static]

Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc.

Parameters:
scr_addr The Local scratch address. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
aura Global aura the block came from. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
Returns:
Pointer to the block or NULL on failure

static int cvmx_fpa3_num_auras ( void   )  [inline, static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Accessor functions to return number of AURAS in an FPA3 depending on SoC model. The number is per-node for models supporting multi-node configurations.

static int cvmx_fpa3_num_pools ( void   )  [inline, static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Accessor functions to return number of POOLS in an FPA3 depending on SoC model. The number is per-node for models supporting multi-node configurations.

static int cvmx_fpa3_pool_is_enabled ( cvmx_fpa3_pool_t  pool  )  [inline, static]
int cvmx_fpa3_release_aura ( cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura  ) 
int cvmx_fpa3_release_pool ( cvmx_fpa3_pool_t  pool  ) 
cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_reserve_aura ( int  node,
int  desired_aura_num

cvmx_fpa3_pool_t cvmx_fpa3_reserve_pool ( int  node,
int  desired_pool_num 
)
cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_set_aura_for_pool ( cvmx_fpa3_pool_t  pool,
int  desired_aura,
const char *  name,
unsigned  block_size,
unsigned  num_blocks 
)

Function to attach an aura to an existing pool.

Parameters:
node - configure fpa on this node
pool - configured pool to attach aura to
desired_aura - pointer to aura to use, set to -1 to allocate
name - name to register
block_size - size of buffers to use
num_blocks - number of blocks to allocate
Returns:
configured gaura on success, CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_GAURA on failure

Function to attach an aura to an existing pool.

Parameters:
pool is the handle of the POOL to be attached
desired_aura is the number of the AURA resired or -1 for the AURA to be automatically assigned
name is a symbolic name for the new AURA
block_size is the size of all buffers that will be handed out by this AURA
num_blocks is the maximum number of buffers that can be handed out by this AURA, and can not exceed the number of buffers filled into the attached POOL
Returns:
the AURA handle

Only supported on CN78XX.

cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_setup_aura_and_pool ( int  node,
int  desired_aura,
const char *  name,
void *  buffer,
unsigned  block_size,
unsigned  num_blocks 
)

Function to setup and initialize a pool.

Parameters:
node - configure fpa on this node
desired_aura - aura to use, -1 for dynamic allocation
name - name to register
block_size - size of buffers in pool
num_blocks - max number of buffers allowed

Function to setup and initialize a pool.

Parameters:
node is the node number for the pool and memory location
desired_aura is the number of the AURA resired or -1 for the AURA to be automatically assigned
name is a symbolic name for the new AURA
block_size is the size of all buffers that will be handed out by this AURA
num_blocks is the maximum number of buffers that can be handed out by this AURA, and can not exceed the number of buffers filled into the attached POOL
buffer is an optionally caller-supplied memory for the buffers or NULL to cause the buffer memory to be allocated automatically.
Returns:
the AURA handle

Note: if the buffer memory is supplied by caller, the application will be responsable to free this memory. The POOL number is always automatically assigned.

Only supported on CN78XX.

static void cvmx_fpa3_setup_aura_qos ( cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura,
bool  ena_red,
uint64_t  pass_thresh,
uint64_t  drop_thresh,
bool  ena_bp,
uint64_t  bp_thresh 
) [inline, static]

Configure the QoS parameters of an FPA3 AURA.

Parameters:
aura is the FPA3 AURA handle
ena_bp enables backpressure when outstanding count exceeds 'bp_thresh'
ena_red enables random early discard when outstanding count exceeds 'pass_thresh'
pass_thresh is the maximum count to invoke flow control
drop_thresh is the count threshold to begin dropping packets
bp_thresh is the back-pressure threshold
cvmx_fpa3_pool_t cvmx_fpa3_setup_fill_pool ( int  node,
int  desired_pool,
const char *  name,
unsigned  block_size,
unsigned  num_blocks,
void *  buffer 
)

Create an FPA POOL and fill it up with buffers.

Parameters:
node is the node number for the pool and memory location
desired_pool is the local pool number desired or -1 for first available
name is the symbolic name to assign the POOL
block_size is the size of all buffers held in this POOL
num_blocks is the number of free buffers to fill into the POOL
buffer is an optionally caller-supplied memory for the buffers or NULL to cause the buffer memory to be allocated automatically.
Returns:
the POOL handle

Note: if the buffer memory is supplied by caller, the application will be responsable to free this memory.

Only supported on CN78XX.

int cvmx_fpa3_shutdown_aura ( cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura  ) 

Discard an AURA.

All buffers allocated via this AURA must be freed prior to discarding the AURA to avoid memory leaks.

Parameters:
aura is the AURA handle
Returns:
0 on success or -1 on error

Note: since the buffers belong with a POOL, discarding an AURA does not remove any buffers from the attached POOL. nor does it free any memory.

Only supported on CN78XX.

int cvmx_fpa3_shutdown_aura_and_pool ( cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t  aura  ) 

Shutdown a POOL and AURA combination.

This function should only be used for an a POOL that is attached to exactly one AURA.

Parameters:
aura is the AURA handle
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error

See also 'cvmx_fpa3_shotdown_pool'.

Only supported on CN78XX.

int cvmx_fpa3_shutdown_pool ( cvmx_fpa3_pool_t  pool  ) 

Destroy an FPA POOL and free its memory.

Parameters:
pool is the POOL handle
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error

All buffers allocated from this POOL must be freed and all AURA attached to this POOL must have been discarded prior to calling this function. Buffer memory will be freed if allocated automatically, otherwise, if the memory was supplied by the caller, after succesful return from this functon the caller supplied memory can be safely freed by the application.

Only supported on CN78XX.
